definition: to think/to believe/to suppose/to wish/to want/to miss (feel wistful about the absence of sb or sth)

sentences.english: During this time I was diagnosed with anticipatory anxiety disorder.
sentences.chinese: 就在那个时候，我被诊断出患有预想性焦虑失调症。

sentences.english: The simulation result truly reveals the preconceived distribution of the sound field.
sentences.chinese: 仿真结果真实地反映了预想声场的分布情况。

sentences.english: At the beginning of a meal, take slightly less than what you think you'll eat.
sentences.chinese: 开始用餐时，取少于预想餐量的食物。

sentences.english: It's taking a little longer to get there than I thought.
sentences.chinese: 在路上的时间比我预想的要长。

sentences.english: The beauties of the West Lake in spring were beyond his expectation.
sentences.chinese: 西湖的春景要比他所预想的更加美丽。

sentences.english: which turns out to be a bit more difficult than I anticipated.
What Coontz found was even more interesting than she'd originally expected.
sentences.chinese: 库茨发现了比她一开始预想的更有趣的东西。

sentences.english: They will be told to re-evaluate their preconceptions.
sentences.chinese: 他们将被告知重新评估他们的预想。

sentences.english: She said she hadn't carried out her work expecting such recognition.
sentences.chinese: 博韦说没有预想自己的所作所为会得到这样的认可。

sentences.english: There should be no preconceived assumptions as to the cause of the OOS result.
sentences.chinese: 不应该对OOS结果的原因进行预想的假定。

sentences.english: And that was also, he thought grumpily, quite predictable.
sentences.chinese: 他心情很坏地想，这些事也是可以预想得到的。

sentences.english: Your stuff takes up more of your time and money than you think.
sentences.chinese: 各类琐事会花费比你预想更多的时间和精力。

sentences.english: I turned on the light, and as predicted the singing stopped.
sentences.chinese: 我打开灯，和预想的一样，那歌声又停了。

sentences.english: He tried creatine, but didn’t see the bulking effect he wanted.
sentences.chinese: 他尝试过肌肉素，但是没有看到他预想的身体变化。

sentences.english: Is this ever not how I expected it would be like.
sentences.chinese: 我原来预想的跟这个可是天差地别。

definition: to imagine/to assume/to envisage/tentative plan/to have consideration for
due to/to stem from/to go beyond (also fig. beyond reason, expectations etc)/to go against (expectations)
to come as no surprise/as expected
as different as can be (idiom)/poles apart
to be on good terms/to be close friends/striving for self-improvement
